page.title: 04Landscape South of the River
page.content: Norbury in the S.W. corner lies at three hundred feet and the ground rises to five hundred feet along the ridge to S.W. The steepest fall in land is at Cackle Hill above Snelston and the banks opposite Church Mayfield. There is a small artificial lake in front of Snelston Hall fed by a stream which runs on into the Dove. Fields are nearly all grass, either permanent pasture or for silage and are fenced with quick thorn hedges or posts and rails. There is some blackthorn as well. Cutting and laying of hedges is still practised, an act encouraged by the "Young Farmers".
